title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.8.43 | 13-03-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Chakshurun Militam Jena Tasvai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Devi Saraswati Vyasam Tato Jaya Mudire
In this session, we will be discussing from the 43rd verse of the 8th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
This is the last prayer by Queen Kunti in this chapter.
Shri Krishna Krishna Sakha Vrishni Rishabhava Nidrup
Kunti Devi is addressing Krishna in different ways in this prayer.
The meaning of this verse is
O Krishna, O friend of Arjuna, O chief among the descendants of Vrishni
You are the destroyer of those political parties which are disturbing elements on this earth.
Your prowess never deteriorates, you are the proprietor of the transcendental abode and
you descend to relieve the distress of the cows, the brahmanas and the devotees.
You possess all mystic powers and you are the preceptor of the entire universe.
You are the Almighty God and I offer you my respectful obeisances.
So Srila Prabhupada says in the purport, a summary of the Supreme Lord Sri Krishna is
made herein by Srimati Kunti Devi.
Kunti Devi knows very well Krishna is not just a relative, not just an ordinary person,
But Krishna is the Supreme Lord.
And he has multiple relationships with his devotees.
Accordingly, he is addressed here in different ways.
So Srila Prabhupada says in the purport, the Almighty Lord has his eternal transcendental abode
where he is engaged in keeping Surabhi cows.
Krishna is always engaged in pastimes with his devotees, especially the cowherd boys,
the cows, the gopis, like that.
Krishna is served by hundreds and thousands of goddesses of fortune in Goloka Brindavana.
He descends on the material world to reclaim his devotees.
He is the one who has the power to annihilate the disturbing elements in groups of political
parties and kings who are supposed to be in charge of administration work.
Actually the kings are meant to rule over the citizens exactly as the representative
Because in reality it is Krishna who maintains everyone.
But if the king does not conduct himself as the representative of Krishna, then he is
not fit to be the ruler of the people in general.
Then Krishna either incarnates to destroy such rulers, or he empowers his devotees to
actually end the rule of such a king.
So, this is a very important point.
So, this is a very important point.
So, this is a very important point.
There are so many non-devotional elements.
So, Srila Prabhupada further explains, Krishna creates, maintains and annihilates by his unlimited
The shastras say that Krishna has nothing to do personally, but that doesn't mean he
He works through his energies, he acts through his energies and his energies are simply
exactly according to his will the different energies will work and they
will carry out Krishna's instructions or Krishna's desires even though Krishna
creates maintains and annulates still he is always full with prowess and does not
deteriorate in potency material world we have experienced when we expand our
energy unless we renew we feel exhausted whereas Krishna he employs his energies
for so many different activities but his energy never reduces
always he is full of all energies full with all energies further Srila Prabhupada says
the cows the brahmanas and the devotees of the Lord are all objects of special attention
cows brahmanas and devotees Krishna particularly is interested in the welfare of the cows and
now all these cows brahmanas and Vaishnavas are object of special attention because
they are very important factors for the general welfare of all

of Kunti Devi in this last prayer, Kunti addresses Lord Krishna as Krishna Sakha. Why? Because she
knows although Arjuna is her own son, but Lord Krishna is more intimately related with Arjuna
than with her. This is a fact. So, Kunti wants to please Krishna by addressing him in his
relationship with Arjuna. So, Kunti wants to please Krishna by addressing him in his relationship
with Arjuna. So, Kunti wants to please Krishna by addressing him in his relationship with his
intimate devotees. That is another secret we have to learn from the Srimad Bhagavatam,
from the Acharyas, from pure devotees, that they know how to please Krishna.
The very way of addressing Krishna by making a reference to his intimate relation with his
pure devotees, that is very, very pleasing to Krishna.
Just like Krishna is addressed as Devaki Nandana, Yashodha Nandana, Nanda Nandana. These are all
ways of addressing Krishna, indicating thereby that Krishna has an intimate relationship with his devotees.
the term Krishna also refers to Draupadi also. So, Krishna Saka, also indicates Krishna's
